bibl.title: Letter fragment to Henry Rose Carter, May 26, 1917

div1.p: Carter is ordered to attend the Society of Tropical Medicine conference and the National Malaria Committee meeting.

div1.head: Letter fragment to Henry Rose Carter, May 26, 1917
div1.opener:
JKC
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
PAB
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
May 26, 1917.
Assistant Surgeon-General H. R. Carter,
U. S. Public Health Service,
Marine Hospital,
New Orleans, La.
Sir:
div1.p:
The following Bureau telegram of May 25 is hereby
confirmed:-

“Attend conference relative field investigations
Washington, May twenty ninth.” -

Upon completion of the conference, you will pro-
ceed to New York, N. Y., via Baltimore, Md., to attend
the meeting of the Society of Tropical Medicine, June
4-6, 1917. While in New York, you will also attend the
meeting of the National Malaria Committee to be held
June 6-7.

Reports will be made of both of the above meetings,
and a special report will be made by you of the confer-
ence in so far as relates to future studies. -

While on this detail, your status will be that of
special temporary duty and, upon completion of the duty
